google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Bill. The compass calibration is a property of the phone - it's just SkyMap telling you what the phone is telling *it*. If you can't get it to calibrate to high accuracy, it might still be OK. You can dismiss the dialog and prevent it showing again. The map might be accurate, or might not, depending on the phone compass' accuracy.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Matt. Unfortunately your phone seems to lack a gyro. This will make the image jumpier as the phone's compass is very sensitive to magnetic interference. If you go to settings/sensor settings (advanced) and select disable gyro then Sky Map will try an alternate method. You'll see some options to increase the smoothing (though it'll be laggier).
